title: Watchmen episode 1: All the questions we need answering
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

**Warning, spoilers ahead for Watchmen.**

HBO series Watchmen finally kicked off last night with episode one landing on our screens.

The superhero drama opened with the truly intense episode titled Running Out of Ice and introduced us to Regina King’s character Detective Angela Abar/Sister Night and a whole wealth of problems.

Although most of us are already obsessed with the comic book adaptation, we have a lot of questions that need answering already.

Is Chief Judd Crawford really dead?

Cheif Judd Crawford’s (Don Johnson) death was without a doubt the most shocking revelation from episode one.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The character’s body was found lynched on a branch of an oak tree with old disabled man Will Reeves (Louis Gossett) claiming that it was him who carried out the murder.

We’re already obsessed with Watchmen (Picture: HBO)

But is he really dead? Will he somehow appear in an alternative universe?

That also leads us to the question…

Who really killed Chief Judd Crawford?

Although Will claims he lynched Judd, Detective Angela Abar (Regina King) doesn’t believe him and nor do we.

The most obvious culprit for this heinous crime would be a member of the horrific white supremacist group Seventh Kavalry.

Will someone come clean to the murder? Will Angela get to the bottom of it all? And most importantly, why is Will covering for whoever did it?

What’s up with the guy in the mansion?

Jeremy Irons’ character is the smartest man in the world and has been living it up in his mansion with his two members of staff.

The show hasn’t yet confirmed that he is Veidt/Ozymandias, but we’re quietly confident that he is the supposed ‘dead’ character.

What anniversary is he celebrating? (Picture: HBO)

But what is he working on and what’s his relevance to the rest of the story?

Also what anniversary did he celebrate with cake and more importantly, why does he slice it with a horseshoe?

Advertisement

How on earth did Robert Redford become president?

Robert Redford has managed to come into power and is president of the United States in Watchmen.

We’re yet to learn about how the actor managed to get to the White House but we do know that he’s been there for some time – 28 years in fact.

Watchmen is available to stream on HBO in the US and Sky Atlantic and NOW TV in the UK.
